message_1: What is the maximum energy of alpha particles emitted from a polonium-210 source, and what is the range of the alpha particles in air?
message_2:
Polonium-210 (Po-210) undergoes alpha decay, emitting alpha particles with a maximum energy of approximately 5.3 MeV (Mega-electron volts).

The range of alpha particles in air depends on various factors such as energy, pressure, and temperature. However, under normal conditions (room temperature and atmospheric pressure), the range of 5.3 MeV alpha particles in air is approximately 3-4 cm (centimeters). Alpha particles lose their energy quickly due to ionization and have a relatively short range in air.
